channel.title: RuneScript
channel.description:
Hello MoparScape, I am making this post to inform everyone about a project I plan on making, a RuneScript compiler. The project will open source and written in either C or C++.
What is RuneScript? [i][b]RuneScript[/b] is a scripting language that Jagex uses to create content for RuneScape.[/i]
The compilers program model will follow something similar to this: [i]parse raw RS files -> generate instruction lists -> error checking -> general optimizations -> generate bytecode -> output classes[/i]
The public knowledge of RuneScript is limited, for more information about RuneScript please refer to this [url=http://runescape.wikia.com/wiki/RuneScript]article[/url].
Constructive criticism is welcome. If you would like to help contribute to the project, please send me a PM.

item.title: RuneScript
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

xryz:

doesnt this have a some info on working with java bytecode? http://download.forge.objectweb.org/asm/asm4-guide.pdf i thought the very beginning tries to give you a better understanding of a compiled java class.

i’ve always found asm’s guide to be poor

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScript
item.dc:creator: @management management
item.description:
@management wrote:

[quote=“wildskiller, post:9, topic:452549”][quote author=management link=topic=555428.msg4066395#msg4066395 date=1343929324]
Hello MoparScape, I am making this post to inform everyone about a project I plan on making, a RuneScript compiler. The project will open source and written in either C or C++.

What is RuneScript?
RuneScript is a scripting language that Jagex uses to create content for RuneScape.

The compilers program model will follow something similar to this:
parse raw RS files -> generate instruction lists -> error checking -> general optimizations -> generate bytecode -> output classes

The public knowledge of RuneScript is limited, for more information about RuneScript please refer to this article.

Constructive criticism is welcome. If you would like to help contribute to the project, please send me a PM.
[/quote]

Is RuneScript a language converted from java?[/quote]
No it’s a scripting language that’s compiled into java bytecode.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScript
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“management, post:7, topic:452549”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=555428.msg4066611#msg4066611 date=1343942223]
Also if you do go about doing this, invest some time into making a clientscript decompiler.
[/quote]

What do you mean by client script?[/quote]

Research it. I don’t have any good explanation other than it’s used for the modern client’s (414>) widget system. Such as when a widget is clicked, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScript
item.dc:creator: @management management
item.description:
@management wrote:

sinisoul:

Also if you do go about doing this, invest some time into making a clientscript decompiler.

What do you mean by client script?

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScript
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Hmm, syntax wise it's similar to any C-style language, except variable names are prefixed with their type (eg. %varname is an integer). We also lack full array support. Other than that, it'd do pretty much anything you could do in C or Java.

This makes a lot of sense seeing as there are only two types of variables: string/integer. But also its important to remember there is a local (script) and global scope.

Also if you do go about doing this, invest some time into making a clientscript decompiler.

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScript
item.dc:creator: @management management
item.description:
@management wrote:

There are virtually no libraries for writing class files in C.

As I have said to t4, I want to learn what exactly makes up a class, therefore, I’ll write something to suit my needs.

how do you plan on parsing something without a grammar? I don’t think anyone knows the syntax of runescript.

Well, I’ll start by going from what we know (everything that’s on the wiki), and from there, something similar to C

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScript
item.dc:creator: @management management
item.description:
@management wrote:

t4:

why not use existing scripting engines?

Because this not only intrigues me, but seems like a great way to learn how Java classes are composed.

veer:

If you plan to emit class files, you should probably use Java.

That was an idea, but I prefer C\C++, why do you suggest I use Java?

Read full topic

item.title: RuneScript
item.dc:creator: @slavemaster veer
item.description:
@slavemaster wrote:

If you plan to emit class files, you should probably use Java.

Read full topic
